full_text:
1
DETECTIVE 2:	So you're saying you're sure you were sixteen now?



Uh, [sigh] I don't want to say I'm sure of my age. I was under seventeen a hundred percent.
DETECTIVE 2:	So you were sixteen and something, you weren't, it wasn't your seventeenth birthday yet.

If you give me a moment I'll recall.
DETECTIVE:	Yeah, sure. Take your time.

Um, this past summer I was
DETECTIVE 2:	How old are you right now?

I'm eighteen right now.
DETECTIVE 2:	Okay, so this December,

This?
DETECTIVE 2:	Not this past December, the one before it, you turned seventeen.
So it's before
//Yeah. It was
DETECTIVE 2:	Two Christmases ago.

During that summer.
DETECTIVE 2:	So it was the summer before you turned seventeen.

Uh huh. As far as I remember, yeah.
DETECTIVE 2:	One of those months, you don't know if it was June, July, August,

It was during the summer. I mean, my summer since I'm in school is only considered like June, July, and half of August, and it was in between those. Because I wanted to go to Maine for the summer.
DETECTIVE 2:	//Did you go to Maine?

No.
Defense Transcript 07/26/17		October 11, 2005 PBPD &
Page 2347		Public Records Request No.: 17-295
DOJ-OGR-00032660
